apt.processors

Class FutureGroupProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • apt.processors.AptAbstractFutureProcessor
      • apt.processors.FutureGroupProcessor
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FieldFutureGroupProcessor

    public class FutureGroupProcessor
extends AptAbstractFutureProcessor
    This annotation processor processes Future annotations that appear at the declaration of a local array. For example:

    (a)Future
    Obj[] futureGroup = new Obj[num];

    The processor only allows one dimensional future groups. This type is specifically used for grouping TaskID objects that return the same type (e.g., Integer), and allows users to set a barrier in their program to wait for the tasks until they are all finished. The waiting occurs at the first access to an element of the array.

    For example:

    Obj element = futureGroup[0];

    gets the following statements added before it by the compiler.

    try{
       _futureGroupTaskID_.wiatTillFinished();
    }catch(Exception e){
       e.printStackTrace();
    }

    for(int i = 0; i < futureGroup.size(); i++){
       futureGroup[i] = _futureGroupTaskID_.getReturnResult(i);
    }

    Since:
    2016
    Author:
    Mostafa Mehrabi
